Subjective: Tired for 2 months. Fatigue all day. Sleeps a lot but wakes up tired. No clear cause. No recent illness. No fever, cough, or shortness of breath. No smoking. No alcohol. No recent travel. No recent changes in appetite or weight. No joint pain or swelling. No morning stiffness. No snoring. No respiratory problems. No allergies. No unusual palpitations or chest pain. No changes in bowel movements. No changes in urination. No other symptoms. Request: Wants to know if there's something wrong with his body. Fears rheumatism or other underlying conditions.
Objective: BP: 110/60. HR: 40-60. Lungs: clear. Heart: normal. Back: tender to palpation in lower lumbar region. Abdomen: normal. Intestines: active peristalsis. No gross abnormalities.
Assessment: Fatigue syndrome. Susp. hypothyroidism. No signs of rheumatoid arthritis.
Plan: Blood tests: anemia, thyroid function, inflammation. Follow-up phone appointment in 1 day to discuss results. Schedule phone appointment through Atal Medial. Monitor for worsening symptoms or new symptoms.
